Keywords: focus visible indicator keyboard outline ring
Description: Ensure focus indicator is clearly visible on all interactive elements
Do: Use focus-visible with 2px+ outline offset from element
Don't: Remove outline without replacement

Description: Ensure focused element is not obscured by sticky/fixed elements
Do: scroll-margin-top to account for sticky headers
Don't: Fixed headers covering focused form fields

Description: Focused element must be fully visible (not partially hidden)
Do: Ensure entire focused element is in viewport
Don't: Allowing partial visibility of focused element

Description: Focus indicator must have sufficient size and contrast
Do: 3:1 contrast ratio + 2px thickness + covers full perimeter
Don't: Thin single-side border change as only indicator

Description: Interactive targets must be at least 24×24px CSS pixels
Do: min-width: 24px min-height: 24px for all interactive elements
Don't: Inline links or buttons smaller than 24px

Description: Interactive targets should be at least 44×44px for comfortable touch
Do: 44×44px minimum on mobile + adequate spacing between targets
Don't: Small targets close together on touch screens

Description: Animations triggered by interaction can be disabled by users
Do: Provide prefers-reduced-motion override for all animations
Don't: Animations that cannot be paused or disabled

Keywords: pause stop hide auto-play carousel animation moving
Description: Content that auto-plays can be paused stopped or hidden
Do: Provide visible pause/stop controls for auto-playing content
Don't: Auto-playing carousels or videos without controls

Description: Color is not the only means of conveying information
Do: Use icons + text + color for states like error/success
Don't: Red border only to indicate error

Description: Text has minimum contrast ratio against background
Do: 4.5:1 for normal text + 3:1 for large text (18pt+/14pt bold)
Don't: Low contrast gray text on light backgrounds

Description: Enhanced contrast ratios for maximum readability
Do: 7:1 for normal text + 4.5:1 for large text
Don't: Decorative text below 7:1 ratio on content pages

Keywords: non-text contrast ui component border icon
Description: UI components and graphical objects have 3:1 contrast against adjacent colors
Do: 3:1 contrast for borders icons focus indicators
Don't: Low contrast borders or icons on similar backgrounds

Description: Programmatically communicate structure and relationships
Do: Use semantic HTML elements and ARIA landmarks
Don't: <div> soup without semantic meaning

Description: DOM order matches visual and logical reading order
Do: Ensure CSS layout doesn't reorder content visually vs DOM
Don't: CSS order or flex-direction that breaks reading flow
Code_Bad: order: -1; /* visually first but last in DOM */

Description: Headings and labels describe topic or purpose
Do: Descriptive headings in logical hierarchy (h1→h2→h3)
Don't: Vague headings or skipped heading levels

Description: Inputs have visible labels explaining required format
Do: Visible <label> associated with each input
Don't: Placeholder-only inputs without labels

Description: Errors are clearly identified and described in text
Do: Specific error message near the field + aria-describedby
Don't: Generic "form has errors" at top of page
Code_Good: Enter a valid email address

Description: Suggest corrections when input errors are detected
Do: Show expected format or example values near errors
Don't: Only showing "invalid" without help

Description: Authentication doesn't rely solely on cognitive function tests
Do: Allow paste in password fields + support password managers
Don't: Blocking paste in password fields or using text CAPTCHAs

Description: Help mechanisms appear in same relative order across pages
Do: Place help link/chat in consistent location (e.g. footer or FAB)
Don't: Help in different locations on different pages
Code_Bad: /* Help in header on page A footer on page B */

Description: Provide skip links to bypass repeated content blocks
Do: Hidden skip link that appears on focus before main nav
Don't: No skip navigation link

Keywords: aria name role value state widget
Description: Custom components expose name role and value to assistive technology
Do: ARIA attributes on custom widgets matching behavior
Don't: Custom widgets without ARIA

Description: Non-text content has text alternatives
Do: Descriptive alt text for informative images + alt='' for decorative
Don't: Missing alt attributes or alt='image'

Description: Status messages are announced by screen readers without focus change
Do: aria-live regions for dynamic content updates
Don't: Status changes that aren't announced

Description: Pre-recorded audio/video has alternatives
Do: Captions for video + transcripts for audio
Don't: Auto-play video without captions
